intro: Rubus pseudoguentheri, commonly known as the Guenther’s blackberry, is a species of brambles native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in woodland edges and disturbed soils, often forming dense thickets. Botanically, it is closely related to other Rubus species, sharing similar morphological and ecological traits.
